channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: White House unveils TrumpRx website for medication discounts
item.description: Under Trump administration deals to lower drug prices, pharmaceutical companies are offering some of their drugs at discounted prices through a new website called TrumpRx.gov.
item.content:encoded:
Under Trump administration deals to lower drug prices, pharmaceutical companies are offering some of their drugs at discounted prices through a new website called TrumpRx.gov.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Virginia Democrats show map to counter Trump redistricting but its future is unclear
item.description: The new map still requires approval from the courts and the voters but, if enacted, it could help Democrats win four more House seats
item.content:encoded:
The new map still requires approval from the courts and the voters but, if enacted, it could help Democrats win four more House seats

(Image credit: Shaban Athuman)
item.dc:creator: Jahd Khalil

item.title: What to watch at the 2026 Olympics
item.description: NPR journalists are at the 2026 Winter Olympics. Join host A Martinez and correspondents Becky Sullivan, Brian Mann, and Rachel Triesman as they talk about what's coming up.
item.content:encoded:
NPR journalists are at the 2026 Winter Olympics. Join host A Martinez and correspondents Becky Sullivan, Brian Mann, and Rachel Triesman as they talk about what's coming up.

(Image credit: Marco Bertorello/AFP)

item.title: A 'Jane Doe' in the R. Kelly trials is ready to share her real name. And her story
item.description: A once anonymous R. Kelly survivor, Reshona Landfair is now ready to reclaim her voice.
item.content:encoded:
A once anonymous R. Kelly survivor, Reshona Landfair is now ready to reclaim her voice.

(Image credit: Grand Central Publishing)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: What a crowded congressional primary in N.J. says about the state of Democrats
item.description: The contest is one of the first congressional primaries of the year where we will find out what issues are currently resonating with some Democratic voters. Here are some key things to know.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

The contest is one of the first congressional primaries of the year where we will find out what issues are currently resonating with some Democratic voters. Here are some key things to know.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt/Getty Images; Alex Wong/Getty Images; Chris Pedota/USA Today Network via Reuters)
item.dc:creator: P. Kenneth Burns

item.title: The Winter Olympics in Italy were meant to be sustainable. Are they?
item.description: Italy's Winter Olympics promised sustainability. But in Cortina, environmentalists warn the Games could scar these mountains for decades.
item.content:encoded:
Italy's Winter Olympics promised sustainability. But in Cortina, environmentalists warn the Games could scar these mountains for decades.

(Image credit: Valerio Muscella for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Their film was shot in secret and smuggled out of Iran. It won an award at Sundance
item.description: Between war, protests and government crackdowns, the filmmakers raced to finish and smuggle their portrait of Tehran's underground arts scene to the prestigious film festival.
item.content:encoded:
at the Sundance Film Festival.'/>

Between war, protests and government crackdowns, the filmmakers raced to finish and smuggle their portrait of Tehran's underground arts scene to the prestigious film festival.

(Image credit: Mandalit del Barco)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Day 5 of search for Nancy Guthrie: 'We still believe Nancy is still out there'
item.description: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $50,000 for information leading to the recovery of Guthrie and/or the arrest and conviction of anyone involved in her disappearance.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI is offering a reward of up to $50,000 for information leading to the recovery of Guthrie and/or the arrest and conviction of anyone involved in her disappearance.

(Image credit: Jan Sonnenmair)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Trump officials propose testing a citizenship question amid a push to alter the census
item.description: The Trump administration proposes to include a question about U.S. citizenship status in this year's field test of the 2030 census, as Republicans push to alter the counts behind voting maps.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration proposes to include a question about U.S. citizenship status in this year's field test of the 2030 census, as Republicans push to alter the counts behind voting maps.

(Image credit: Stefani Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Some Public Health Service officers deployed in detention centers suffer 'moral distress'
item.description: A special corps of health care workers have been called in to work with detained immigrants and many feel deeply conflicted about the assignment, saying they're not able to provide good care.
item.content:encoded:
A special corps of health care workers have been called in to work with detained immigrants and many feel deeply conflicted about the assignment, saying they're not able to provide good care.

(Image credit: Stephen Smith)
item.dc:creator: Keren Landman
